text: Rwanda is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, because of the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be the nation's tenth consecutive appearance at the Summer Olympics. ==Athletics== Rwandan athletes achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank |-align=center |aligin=left|John Hakizimana |align=left rowspan=2|Men's marathon | | |-align=center |align=left|Felicien Muhitira | | |} ==Cycling== ===Road=== Rwanda entered one rider to compete in the men's Olympic road race, by virtue of his top 50 national finish (for men) in the UCI World Ranking. {|class=wikitable style=font-size:90%;text-align:center |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |- |align=left| |align=left|Men's road race | | |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020 Category:2020 in Rwandan sport
title: Rwanda at the 2020 Summer Olympics
